Parking is in front of the unit and can be a little challenging as there is a school nearby and parents line up to pick up there students, but if you pay attention to times and what you're doing, it's NO PROBLEM at all. I would definitely recommend this unit!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This 1920s bungalow in Dixieland is just as described. It is clean, updated and decorated with comfortable furnishings. It is spacious for one or two people. Not pictured is a nook off the bedroom that includes a desk, as well as a washer and dryer. As others have stated in their reviews, the hot and cold are reversed in the bathroom. It is a minor inconvenience. The kitchen has everything needed for meal preparation.
The home is located across the street from an elementary school and within walking distance of a lovely park. The driveway is tight but manageable when care is taken to back into the assigned parking spot.
If youâ€™re a golfer, there are many courses from which to choose. If you do not have a rental car, an Uber to Big Cypress Golf Club is $10 plus gratuity.
If youâ€™re a teacher attending the Center for Guided Montessori Studies at Lakeland Montessori School, this bungalow is a great option as a short-term rental.

There was no shampoo/conditioner in the bathroom, the kitchen is awkward and tiny crammed inside the laundry closet with the central air unit. It is in a beautiful area but not within walking distance to any restaurants or grocery stores. And since the house is divided into multiple rental units you hear others in the house. Very strict parking instructions and other rules. Just overall felt like a stressful stay instead of a valued guest. He kept emphasizing being a good guest but didnâ€™t show he was a good host.

review_text: The house is clean and in a beautiful location! The host is very communicative. The kitchenette was more than enough for our needs. We only had 2 drawbacks and they are not necessarily bad things depending on what you are looking for. First of all the beds and pillows and VERY soft. If you like soft mattresses great! But we had trouble sleeping and ended up with a lot of back pain. Again that's very person specific. Secondly the suite is attached to the main house which means doors, dog barks, voices, etc carry through. The host was great about keeping sounds down at night. Unfortunately we were trying to nap in the day often. Ear plugs will fix that one if you have a weird sleep schedule like us. Otherwise the place was wonderful! This is by no means a negative review, but I often wish people would comment on mattresses and showers when im looking for a place to stay. (P.s. shower does get nice and hot).

,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text: BEWARE, this home has storm damage to the roof, the soffits are missing, the roof is covered with a tarp, it is not in the condtioned that is pictured. It has been damaged for 7 weeks and exposed to Florida humidity. We entered the home at 1 am and could not see the damage outside. Upon entering, there was a very strong smell of mildew and it was very damp inside the home. I thought that turning the air up would help. Considering the vents are in the ceiling running the air made the smell even worse instead of better. Upon waking up in the morning our nose and throats were burning and my son who has allergies was very congested and had a headache. I searched the home for mold and discovered the damaged roof. We left immediately and informed the owners. The owner refused to offer a full refund and made a stressful situation even harder. If I was made aware of the damage to the home I would have chosen to stay at a different property. The home is well decorated and could be lovely but unfortunatly at this time it is in need of roof repairs.

review_text: Let me start off by saying that this place is a dream! Awesome quiet neighborhood with lake Hollingsworth in the mix, a lake they made this stay more at home. Let's forget the lake for a sec, the host is who made this stay even better. Cheryl, when you & potential renters read this I just wanted to say thank you from the bottom of my heart because you're genuine, very transparent, & completely there for your renters, no matter how many YouTube vids it takes. You made my renting experience super accommodating. Small note, I love clean cars so having no sprinklers was a huge plus in my book. The parking is great being right in front of the house. I will admit, when I received the instruction text the day before I kind of thought she was going to be a possible rough host, absolutely not, Cheryl was/is worth every penny. BY FAR the best place I've rented from Air BNB & will definitely be going back. I now have experienced Lakeland FL for the first time & really loved it, it was the peace for me guys. Also being located in between two big cities worked out very well with many possible activities, only if you're willing to take the trips out there. This home is perfect for just yourself or for a couple. Again, Cheryl you were the epitome of what a host is & absolutely nothing short of sheer professionalism and with a splash of spectacularism lol

Stayed with kids
review_text: We were here for 9 days felt like a home away from home. The world can be so small sometimes in connecting with the we found out they were fellow Canadians and too make it even crazier they had family that owns an airbnb right in our backyard. When we booked it we didn't realize we had friends a short distance away. If you stay here make sure you visit Circle B bar reserve it was one of our favorite spot to see a bunch of wildlife. The location is very central to Florida an hour give or take to both Tampa and Orlando airports. Close to Disney, Legoland, Busch gardens, Clearwater Beach. We made lots of day trips to all these places. If you wanted to stay close Lakeland has everything you need. Dont forget to try Fred's Restaurant southern home cooking buffet and Catfish country to get you catfish, gator and frog legs. Also when your in town make sure you get to Whiskey Bent BBQ supply. We would for sure stay here again. The McMasters and Hunter families.

review_text: Absolutely perfect. I lived in Lakeland for many years abs moved away a few moths ago. I took an impromptu trip back to Lakeland and was fortunate enough to find Serenity available. Pet friendly and affordable. Steve was gracious with my multiple questions and when I locked myself out. My dog, Misha loved the cold terrazzo floors after walks around the lake in the Florida heat. The space is large, nostalgic and decorated with simple, Lakeland decor that is true to the local artist, Swan loving community. Super comfy King bed, very quiet neighborhood, fully stocked kitchen, and WiFi. I got my steps in with multiple trips a couple blocks away to lake Morton, which is home to tons of aquatic birds, but Lakeland is specifically known for their Swans. My local Lakeland recommendations for visitors: Swan Brewing (try the Bean), the downtown Saturday market, Mitchells Coffee House, Born and Bread and Palace Pizza. Staying in the historic district on the lakes, refreshed my soul.

Overall, a well-located, affordable place to stay for 2-3 days.

If you are looking for place that is pet friendly, impeccably clean, safe and a place to stay with walkable streets filled with quaint homes and serenity surroundings, then this is the place for you. There is outside seating in the yard to enjoy with company. There were so many places for us to walk our dog and he loved it! The beautiful house was only a short five-minute walk to Lake Morton with all of its bird life...swans, ducks and more! So many of the homes in the neighborhood are 100-year-old historic places and were absolutely charming. We met people on the sidewalks who treated us like we were part of the neighborhood. We were moments away from art museum, library, downtown dining, the Saturday Farmers Market, movie theater, shopping and entertainment.
Stephen was available to answer questions, make suggestions, and attentive to needs.
A great place to spend a day, a week or a month! You can't go wrong with this one.

review_text: As a DPT student I needed to secure housing for my rotation at LRH. I struck gold with Stephenâ€™s listing. Unfamiliar with Lakeland, I needed somewhere with parking, workspace, privacy, peace and quiet given my busy schedule and student budget. The place is much bigger than it looks online. Plenty of space for indoor workouts in either the living or bedroom, huge TV, clean bathroom with great water pressure, Fully equipped kitchen with everything mentioned in the listing. Cozy and charming across the board. Surrounding area is idyllic, with the public library, historical district, restaurants, etc. within a 5-10 minute walk. Of course, Lakeland has lakes, and theyâ€™re beautiful. Running around Morton and Hollingsworth became part of my routine and the neighborhood is lush in nature and suburban architecture. Above all, Stephen is a phenomenal host. I had a 4 hour drive to the place and he waited around to meet face to face and help me get settled in. He has my highest recommendation.

The location of the house is fantastic - it is just up the street from a beautiful lake and just a few blocks away from restaurants, stores, and downtown Lakeland.
Finding this bungalow was a real treat, and I highly recommend a stay there to anyone. I hope to be back up and visit again soon.

name: Jonathan
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
August 2022
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
Wow! Just a perfectly wonderful stay, from start to finish, top to bottom. The location is quintessentially Lakeland. No vehicle needed; once you exit this warm and well appointed auxiliary residence, it's a convenient trip to any number of noteworthy Lakeland landmark locations-Lake Morton, Lake Hollingsworth, Hollis Gardens, Munn Park and downtown Lakeland, the recently revived Dixieland area, Florida Southern College and its world class collection of Frank Lloyd Wright-designed architectural...the list could go on and on.
We stayed a month, and, if it were up to me, we would've stayed many months more. Being a dog friendly property in a dog friendly neighborhood that's located in a dog friendly city meant our 5 year old Dalmatian-labradlor (Dalmador? Labratian?) had as enjoyable of a time as we did.
Along with being an active, well-respected member of his community, and a snazzy dresser, the host is exceptional in his thoughtfulness, expedient in his communication, courteous in his presence (his main residence is adjacent to the stand alone AirBnB), knowledgeable about the area, and exceedingly receptive to suggestions.
If you're on the fence over a Central Florida destination, don't be. Do yourself a favor and book the stay here. Since I moved to Florida in 2015, major media outlets have consistently ranked Lakand as one of the best places to live (in the entire USA). And, for me, having lived in several fabulous cities, (from Chicago, IL to Portland, OR) I wouldn't hesitate to place Lakeland at the very top for its quality of life. It's authentic. It's energetic. It's engaged and it engages. And this property is the perfect entryway to the idyllic Lakeland life.
Perfectly sized for the individual traveler, a couple, or a small family (maybe even a doggo or two).
Other, sometimes overlooked, opportunities to make this listing your 'home base'...
â–ªï¸ Orlando theme park-based vacations? âœ…ï¸
â–ªï¸ Gulf Coast beach trips? âœ…ï¸
â–ªï¸ Space Coast outings? âœ…ï¸
And make sure you let the host know "Jonathan sent you"!

name: Jonathan
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
July 2022
,
Â·
Stayed with a pet
review_text:
Having travelled extensively over these past 6 months, and with lodging accomodations running the gamut from activity-filled resorts, extended stay hotels, roadside motels, and a multifarious array of short term owner offered properties, I have enjoyed, what seems like a lifetime's worth of travel related experiences. And, paramount of all amongst these lessons is what attributes (to me) make for the 'perfect' stay. While this mix of amenities and features, provisions and acoutrements, may differ dramatically amongst travelers, I am very confident when I say this:
Stephen's listing will provide you with a stay as perfect as it gets.
This comfortable, well provisioned space, which is amply sized, impeccably located, dutifully attended, and proudly offered shines as a beacon of hospitality amongst a sea of souped up toolsheds, which (while apropos and acceptable for a great many instances) lack the composition and character that this guest house intrinsically displays upon arrival.
Do yourself a favor when in Central Florida and go see for yourself. But, I'd recommend doing so expeditiously, or else, you may find that the author of this review and his family have booked everything available .
An abbreviated "highlight reel" (things that really resonated with us):
â— Not only was the house immaculately clean upon our arrival, the host provided every cleaning supply and tool imaginable, which we gladly made use of (when traveling with a 5 year old boy and a 5 year old Dalmatian-Labrador mix, this type of host forethought is a gamechanger)
â— There is no lack of water pressure in the shower, and the water temperature heats up very quickly.
â— The air conditioning blows cold and strong, efficiently and effectively cooling tne whole place using 2 Samsung minisplit systems, both of which are jam packed with user options and are remote control operated.
And the piÃ¨ce(s) de rÃ©sistance....
â— Fully stocked and thoroughly supplied kitchen? Definitely! No shortage of host-provided flatware, silverware, drinkware, and serviceware!
Extra neat bonus finds: a digital toaster and 4 different types of Ziploc baggies - now, that's a host that really cares!
My entire family- 2 adults (human), one 5 year old (human), and one 5 year old (Labrador-Dalmatian mix) all scored this listing as "the perfect stay".
(especially the dog...he liked the ample squirrel population for recreation and nearby green spaces for relief)

There's a full list of suggestions on what to do including weekly events and options for laundry. Stephen was a very welcoming host and very attentive to our questions , wants &needs. He always responded in a timely manner and was easy to reach. When we come back to Lakeland, we will definitely be booking here again.

I canâ€™t recommend staying here for 2 reasons.
First, the headboard in one of the bedrooms fell down. We found that it was hung on the wall with large picture hangers and tape. There were no screws and no anchors. It was unsafe. Thankfully, no one was hurt. I sent a message and photo to the host but she did not respond. The next day, she sent another message asking for â€œpositive feedback.â€ She never mentioned the headboard. Iâ€™ve had minor problems in other airbnbs before but I never had a host that wouldnâ€™t respond at all to an issue.
Also, the floors were very dirty. Someone had swept but hadnâ€™t mopped in a long time. Our feet and socks were black on the bottom after walking around the house.
Otherwise, the house is in a great location and looked like the photos when we arrived besides some very minor issues - like a rip in the couch, broken nightstand drawer and missing faceplate on one of the outlets.

Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text: Mariana's home was the perfect fit for my family and I. The apartment is spacious, clean, and has a lot of little touches that make it feel like a home. The pictures really do not do it justice. There are 2 bedrooms, one at the front and a slightly larger one at the rear of the home, with a spacious and open area with the kitchen and living room in between. The couch is huge and comfortable, great for everyone to stretch out and watch TV in the evenings. There is a master bath attached to the rear bedroom, which was also very convenient. The nicely lit outdoor seating was a plus as well. The location was great, being just down the road from Florida Ave and a short walk to Lake Hollingsworth. The lake has a 3 mile walking/jogging trail that runs all the way around it. There is also a really nice coffee shop/commons area just across Florida Ave. On top of this, Mariana is a friendly and attentive host. I would definitely recommend her home!

My parents and I stayed in this beautiful house more than 10 nightS, I must say we recommend 500% this glam house, it is comfortable, cozy, completely new (we found out we were the second guests) super cute and has everything you need for a pleasant stay, it is also located in a wonderful place called LakeLand, surrounded by vegetation, beautiful birds and a lots of beautiful lakes. We used to go everyday to a different lake, the neighbors are very friendly, always with a smile in there faces.
Near the house there are also some good restaurants that completed the whole experience in the neighborhood.
Also we were lucky to meet the owners of the house, Mariana and Federico, a lovely couple with a beautiful little girl, who supported us in every way they could so we could feel comfortable. Total thanks to you. My recommendation is to book this place as soon as you see it available, because I know it's already full for a couple of months in advance, and it totally worth it.
We really had a wonderful vacation in this house ans we will definitely come back SOON!

review_text:
Abel's place was nice and had a very nice autumn TV screen saver with delicate jazz in the background. After complementing her about these things on our wedding night, she first congratulated us on our marriage, then immediately followed up with a request for us to take the trash to the street the next morning. Sorry, not our responsibility. Next time, we'll be sure to bring our bathroom cleaning supplies too, if that's preferred.
The house was good, although we almost ran out of toilet paper, the bed wasn't as comfortable as we would have liked, and the bathroom is so tight, it's almost impossible to not soak the floor when getting into the shower.
My new bride used to be a super host and always leaves places cleaner than most, and have had reviews complementing her on this. The request for the trash definitely put her in a foul mood for a little while. Checkout time was a little on the early side too.

review_text: We needed a small place where we could bring our pets who need meds and monitoring. This was perfect! Backyard well lit with a small Weber grill, covered outdoor seating and fire pit. Indoors was spotless. We were there for our son's wedding so, although it wasn't part of our original plan, we had his best man use the spacious kitchen to prepare the deserts for the event. Because it was in the week between Christmas and New Years the house was decorated with holiday lighting. Upon entry we were met with a Yule log on the TV screen, holiday music, electric candle light, and holiday theme decor. Stayed with a pet
review_text: This was the perfect little house for the month. I was doing a veterinary rotation at the Lakeland SPCA and needed a place to stay for the month. This house was super clean, was in a very quiet and safe neighborhood, close to downtown and shopping areas. The newly renovated bathroom was super nice and the water in the house was always hot. The house had a lot stocked for us when we got there: tons of spices, flour, plastic bags, silverware, plates, and there was even a fully stuffed care package basically in the bathroom! Had shampoos, lotions, makeup remover pads, toothbrushes, toothpaste, razors, and so much more. There wasn't a full grill in the backyard but there was a charcoal grill which was super easy to use and all you had to do was buy the charcoal of your choice from the store. Anytime we had to text or call Abel, he was always quick to respond and answered all of our questions. If you need a clean, safe place to stay in the area that is close to a lot of things, this is the place!

This comes from two people who use fragrance free soaps and pretty much everything else. To some, many, this might not be important.
The home has a very nicely remodeled bathroom. However, if you are a larger person it will be tight for you.
A one last thing, the home has a smart thermostat which is controlled by Abel. He was very responsive to changing the temperature but you did not have the ability to change it yourself.

review_text: I donâ€™t even know where to begin. So many details we loved about this place. The hosts have gone above and beyond to make this an incredible home. Everything we needed and then some. Comfortable, clean, perfect amount of space. Loved the brick road, the houses decorated with Christmas lights on the drive up to the house. Fenced in yard. Our dog loved it. Large windows. The outdoor space with the stringed lights and the hanging hammock chair. The amazing front porch chair I actually napped in one afternoon. We fully took advantage of this place. Felt instantly like home. It was so nice to not have to make an extra trip to the grocery that first night after a ten hour drive to get there. The kitchen had enough goodies to get us started. Took our son to Legoland which is only a 40 minute drive away. We spent a week here and it was the perfect start to our Florida vacation. We were a little sad to leave. Could totally live in this house with its lovely historic charm. Definitely a gem! We hope to come bank. Fell in love with the house and Lakeland.
